tit.cmt: 以下バスの名前はJRバス関東ウェブサイトhttp://www.jrbuskanto.co.jp/bus_route_e/に従います。

sen.j: ドリーム京都号（ドリームきょうとごう）とは、ドリーム号 (高速バス)の一路線で、東京都と京都府京都市を結ぶ夜行高速バスである。
sen.e: Dream Kyoto (Dream Kyoto-Go) is an overnight inter-city highway bus (nicknamed 'Dream-Go') that connects Tokyo Prefecture and Kyoto City in Kyoto Prefecture.
Dream Kyoto-go is an overnight inter-city highway bus (nicknamed 'Dream-go') that connects Tokyo Prefecture and Kyoto City in Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: Dream Kyoto (Dream Kyoto-Go) をDream Kyoto-goに訂正しました。Dream-goに訂正しました。全角の’を半角にしました。
sen.e: Dream Kyoto-go is an overnight inter-city highway bus (nicknamed 'Dream-go') that connects Tokyo Prefecture and Kyoto City in Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: この項目では、派生路線であるドリーム奈良号・女性専用便のレティースドリーム京都号・廉価版の青春ドリーム京都号・青春ドリーム京都・奈良号及び、新宿発着の中央ドリーム京都号・青春中央ドリーム京都号についても記述する。
sen.e: This article lists the history and the operation of Dream Kyoto as well as those of Dream Nara (daughter buses), Ladies Dream Kyoto (buses for the exclusive use of women), Seishun Dream Kyoto (low-priced buses), Seishun Dream Kyoto Nara (low-priced buses), Chuo Dream Kyoto (buses which arrive and depart at Shinjuku) and Seishun Chuo Dream Kyoto (buses which arrive and depart at Shinjuku).

This article lists the history and the operation of Dream Kyoto-go as well as those of Dream Nara-go (daughter buses), Ladies Dream Kyoto-go (buses for the exclusive use of women), Seishun Dream Kyoto-go (low-priced buses), Seishun Dream Kyoto Nara-go (low-priced buses), Chuo Dream Kyoto-go (buses which arrive and depart at Shinjuku) and Seishun Chuo Dream Kyoto-go (buses which arrive and depart at Shinjuku).

This article lists the history and the operation of Dream Kyoto-go as well as those of Dream Nara-go (daughter buses), Ladies Dream Kyoto-go (buses for the exclusive use of women), Seishun Dream Kyoto-go (low-priced buses), Seishun Dream Kyoto Nara-go (low-priced buses), Chuo Dream Kyoto-go (buses which arrive and depart at Shinjuku) and Seishun Chuo Dream Kyoto-go (buses which arrive and depart at Shinjuku).

sen.j: 東京～京都間のドリーム号の運行は、1969年6月10日の東名ハイウェイバス運行開始時に、ドリーム号の京都系統を名古屋経由で設定したのが始まりである。
sen.e: June 10, 1969, with launching Tomei highway bus service, they began the operation of an overnight highway bus that ran between Tokyo and Kyoto via Nagoya ('Dream Kyoto' at present).
June 10, 1969, with launching Tomei highway bus service, they began the operation of an overnight highway bus that ran between Tokyo and Kyoto via Nagoya ('Dream Kyoto-go' at present).
sen.cmt: 全角の’を半角にしました。-go補足しました。
sen.e: June 10, 1969, with launching Tomei highway bus service, they began the operation of an overnight highway bus that ran between Tokyo and Kyoto via Nagoya ('Dream Kyoto-go' at present).

sen.j: その後、東京～名古屋間の利用者が多いことから、1969年12月3日より名古屋系統を新設（現在の「ドリームなごや号」）し、同時に京都系統を直行便化している。
sen.e: As many passengers had used it between Tokyo and Nagoya, December 3, 1969, they began Nagoya route bus service ('Dream Nagoya' at present) and Kyoto route bus quit stopping at Nagoya.
As many passengers had used it between Tokyo and Nagoya, December 3, 1969, they began Nagoya route bus service ('Dream Nagoya-go' at present) and Kyoto route bus quit stopping at Nagoya.
sen.cmt: 全角の’を半角にしました。-go補足しました。
sen.e: As many passengers had used it between Tokyo and Nagoya, December 3, 1969, they began Nagoya route bus service ('Dream Nagoya-go' at present) and Kyoto route bus quit stopping at Nagoya.

sen.j: 長らく1往復のみの運行であったが、JR化後は高速バスブームに乗る勢いで増便。
sen.e: For a long time, they had operated only one bus (one round-trip a day) between Tokyo and Kyoto, however, after Japanese National Railways had been privatized and JR had started, highway buses became popular and they increased the number of the operation.

For a long time, they had operated only one bus (one round-trip a day) between Tokyo and Kyoto, however, after Japanese National Railways had been privatized and JR had started, highway buses became popular and they increased the number of the operation.

For a long time, they had operated only one bus (one round-trip a day) between Tokyo and Kyoto, however, after Japanese National Railways had been privatized and JR had started, highway buses became popular and they increased the number of the operation.

sen.j: また、1988年10月15日には2往復に増発と同時に（この時、「ドリーム3/4号」から「ドリーム京都号」に改称）1往復をJR奈良駅まで延長、「ドリーム奈良号」として運行を開始した。
sen.e: October 15, 1988, they changed the nickname of Kyoto route overnight highway bus from 'Dream 3/4' to 'Dream Kyoto' and increased the number of the operation to two round-trip a day, besides they extended the route to JR Nara Station and began the operation of 'Dream Nara' (one of the buses of 'Dream Kyoto' ran between Tokyo and Nara via Kyoto).

October 15, 1988, they changed the nickname of Kyoto route overnight highway bus from 'Dream 3/4-go' to 'Dream Kyoto-go' and increased the number of the operation to two round-trip a day, besides they extended the route to JR Nara Station and began the operation of 'Dream Nara-go' (one of the buses of 'Dream Kyoto-go' ran between Tokyo and Nara via Kyoto).
sen.cmt: 全角の’を半角にしました。-go補足しました。
sen.e: October 15, 1988, they changed the nickname of Kyoto route overnight highway bus from 'Dream 3/4-go' to 'Dream Kyoto-go' and increased the number of the operation to two round-trip a day, besides they extended the route to JR Nara Station and began the operation of 'Dream Nara-go' (one of the buses of 'Dream Kyoto-go' ran between Tokyo and Nara via Kyoto).

sen.j: 「ドリーム奈良号」では、京都駅で乗降する場合は周遊券での利用も可能であった。
sen.e: The passengers of 'Dream Nara' could use the excursion tickets when they got on/off at Kyoto Station.
The passengers of 'Dream Nara-go' could use the excursion tickets when they got on/off at Kyoto Station.
sen.cmt: 全角の’を半角にしました。-go補足しました。
sen.e: The passengers of 'Dream Nara-go' could use the excursion tickets when they got on/off at Kyoto Station.

sen.j: さらに、1990年3月20日より、新宿発着で中央道経由の「ニュードリーム京都号」（現「中央ドリーム京都号」）を開始している。
sen.e: March 20, 1990, they began the operation of 'New Dream Kyoto ('Chuo Dream Kyoto' at present)' that ran between Shinjuku and Kyoto via Chuo Expressway.
March 20, 1990, they began the operation of 'New Dream Kyoto-go' ('Chuo Dream Kyoto-go' at present) that ran between Shinjuku and Kyoto via Chuo Expressway.
sen.cmt: 全角の’を半角にしました。-go補足しました。括弧の位置を訂正しました。
sen.e: March 20, 1990, they began the operation of 'New Dream Kyoto-go' ('Chuo Dream Kyoto-go' at present) that ran between Shinjuku and Kyoto via Chuo Expressway.

sen.j: 一方、東京～大阪間に開設された廉価版「青春ドリーム大阪号」の好調を受けて、2002年12月20日には同様の「青春ドリーム京都・奈良号」の運行も開始された。
sen.e: As 'Seishun Dream Osaka', a low-priced bus which ran between Tokyo and Osaka, had become profitable, December 20, 2002, they began the operation of 'Seishun Dream Kyoto Nara', a low-priced bus between Tokyo and Kyoto/Nara.

As 'Seishun Dream Osaka-go,' a low-priced bus which ran between Tokyo and Osaka, had become profitable, December 20, 2002, they began the operation of 'Seishun Dream Kyoto/Nara-go,' a low-priced bus between Tokyo and Kyoto/Nara.
sen.cmt: 全角の’を半角にしました。-go補足しました。括弧の位置を訂正しました。/補足しました。コンマの位置を訂正しました。
sen.e: As 'Seishun Dream Osaka-go,' a low-priced bus which ran between Tokyo and Osaka, had become profitable, December 20, 2002, they began the operation of 'Seishun Dream Kyoto/Nara-go,' a low-priced bus between Tokyo and Kyoto/Nara.

sen.j: 廉価版である「青春」便はかなり好調で、2003年7月18日には「青春ニュードリーム京都号」（現「青春中央ドリーム京都号」）の運行も開始されている。
sen.e: The low-priced buses (nicknamed 'Seishun') became highly profitable, July 18, 2003, they began the operation of 'Seishun New Dream Kyoto ('Seishun Chuo Dream Kyoto' at present)'.
The low-priced buses (nicknamed 'Seishun') became highly profitable, July 18, 2003, they began the operation of 'Seishun New Dream Kyoto-go' ('Seishun Chuo Dream Kyoto-go' at present).
sen.cmt: 全角の’を半角にしました。-go補足しました。括弧の位置を訂正しました。コンマの位置を訂正しました。
sen.e: The low-priced buses (nicknamed 'Seishun') became highly profitable, July 18, 2003, they began the operation of 'Seishun New Dream Kyoto-go' ('Seishun Chuo Dream Kyoto-go' at present).

sen.j: また、2004年3月1日からは、女性専用便である「レディースドリーム京都号」の運行も開始された。
sen.e: March 1, 2004, they began the operation of 'Ladies Dream Kyoto', a bus for the exclusive use of women.
March 1, 2004, they began the operation of 'Ladies Dream Kyoto-go,' a bus for the exclusive use of women.
sen.cmt: -go補足しました。コンマの位置を訂正しました。
sen.e: March 1, 2004, they began the operation of 'Ladies Dream Kyoto-go,' a bus for the exclusive use of women.

sen.cmt: *At the off season 1Go changes its name to 101Go and 2Go changes its name to 102Go. As the timetable and the fares are changed, buses’ names are changed to avoid possible confusion of the operation and the buying/selling tickets.

The Buses stop for passengers to take rests at Sakaigawa Parking Area on the down route and at Yoro Service Area on the up route.
sen.cmt: PAをParking Areaに訂正しました。SAをService Areaに訂正しました。
sen.e: The Buses stop for passengers to take rests at Sakaigawa Parking Area on the down route and at Yoro Service Area on the up route.

sen.j: - 運行開始（名古屋経由）。
sen.e: They began the operation of an overnight highway bus between Tokyo and Kyoto via Nagoya.
They began the operation of an overnight highway bus between Tokyo and Kyoto via Nagoya.
They began the operation of an overnight highway bus between Tokyo and Kyoto via Nagoya.

sen.j: - 名古屋系統を新設、京都系統を直行便化。
sen.e: They began Nagoya route bus service and Kyoto route bus quit stopping at Nagoya.
They began Nagoya route bus service and Kyoto route bus quit stopping at Nagoya.
They began Nagoya route bus service and Kyoto route bus quit stopping at Nagoya.

sen.j: - 1日2往復に増便（「ドリーム3/4号」から「ドリーム京都号」に改称）。

They changed the nickname of Kyoto route overnight highway bus from 'Dream 3/4-go' to 'Dream Kyoto-go' and increased the number of the operation to two round-trip a day.

sen.j: 基本的には独立3列（一部4列）39人乗りダブルデッカーが使用される。
sen.e: Most of the cars are double-decker buses equipped with three row independent seats (some cars are equipped four row seats) and each bus contains 39 passengers.
Most of the cars are double-decker buses equipped with three row independent seats (some cars are equipped four row seats) and each bus contains 39 passengers.
Most of the cars are double-decker buses equipped with three row independent seats (some cars are equipped four row seats) and each bus contains 39 passengers.

sen.j: 廉価版は、「青春ドリーム京都・奈良号」には4列シートWC付52人乗りダブルデッカー、「青春中央ドリーム京都号」には4列シートWC付40人乗りハイデッカーが使用される。
sen.e: The low-priced buses, 'Seishun Dream Kyoto Nara', are double-decker buses equipped with four row seats (52 seats) and toilets, and 'Seishun Chuo Dream Kyoto' are high-decker buses equipped with four row seats (40 seats) and toilets.

The low-priced buses, 'Seishun Dream Kyoto/Nara-go,' are double-decker buses equipped with four row seats (52 seats) and toilets, and 'Seishun Chuo Dream Kyoto-go' are high-decker buses equipped with four row seats (40 seats) and toilets.
sen.cmt: 全角の’を半角にしました。-go補足しました。/補足しました。
sen.e: The low-priced buses, 'Seishun Dream Kyoto/Nara-go,' are double-decker buses equipped with four row seats (52 seats) and toilets, and 'Seishun Chuo Dream Kyoto-go' are high-decker buses equipped with four row seats (40 seats) and toilets.

sen.j: 長らく4列シートWC付40人乗りの国鉄専用型式を使用してきたが、1986年に4列シートながらWC付36人乗りスーパーハイデッカーが投入された。
sen.e: For a long time, Japan National Railroad used common coaches equipped with four row seats (40 seats) and a toilet, in 1989 they introduced super high-decker buses equipped with four row seats (36 seats) and a toilet.
sen.cmt: *In 1989 they introduced super high-decker buses equipped with four row seats (36 seats) and a toilet, which were more comfortable and offered a fine view.
sen.e: For a long time, Japan National Railroad used common coaches equipped with four row seats (40 seats) and a toilet, in 1989 they introduced super high-decker buses equipped with four row seats (36 seats) and a toilet.

For a long time, Japan National Railroad used common coaches equipped with four row seats (40 seats) and a toilet, in 1989 they introduced super high-decker buses equipped with four row seats (36 seats) and a toilet.

sen.j: 1989年度には独立3列シートWC付29人乗りスーパーハイデッカーに変更されている。
sen.e: In 1989 they replaced those buses with super high-decker buses equipped with three row independent seats (29 seats) and a toilet.
In 1989 they replaced those buses with super high-decker buses equipped with three row independent seats (29 seats) and a toilet.
In 1989 they replaced those buses with super high-decker buses equipped with three row independent seats (29 seats) and a toilet.

sen.j: 1994年10月1日より2階建車両を投入した。
sen.e: October 1, 1994, they introduced double-decker buses.
October 1, 1994, they introduced double-decker buses.
October 1, 1994, they introduced double-decker buses.

sen.j: 首都圏⇔京阪神地区を結ぶ高速バスの動向については、ドリーム大阪号最近の動向を参照のこと。

sen.j: その他、横浜など東京23区以外の周辺地域と京阪神各地区を結ぶJR系および他社夜行路線バスも多く存在する。
sen.e: At present, many other JR companies and bus companies operate overnight inter-city buses that connect major cities near to 23 Ward of Tokyo (such as Yokohama) and Kyoto/Osaka/Kobe area.
At present, many other JR companies and bus companies operate overnight inter-city buses that connect major cities near to 23 Ward of Tokyo (such as Yokohama) and Kyoto/Osaka/Kobe area.
At present, many other JR companies and bus companies operate overnight inter-city buses that connect major cities near to 23 Ward of Tokyo (such as Yokohama) and Kyoto/Osaka/Kobe area.

sen.j: なお、京都駅より2つ東京駅寄りの大津駅と、池袋駅・大宮駅 (埼玉県)（びわこドリーム号、西武観光バス・西日本JRバス）を結ぶ路線が存在し、類似性が高い。
sen.e: Besides, Seibu Kanko Bus and West Japan JR Bus offer the almost same service: Their 'Biwako Dream' connects Omiya Station (Saitama Prefecture, near to 23 Ward of Tokyo) and Otsu Station (Shiga Prefecture, quite near to Kyoto City) via Ikebukuro (Tokyo).

Besides, Seibu Kanko Bus and West Japan JR Bus offer the almost same service: Their 'Biwako Dream-go' connects Omiya Station (Saitama Prefecture, near to 23 Ward of Tokyo) and Otsu Station (Shiga Prefecture, quite near to Kyoto City) via Ikebukuro (Tokyo).
sen.cmt: 全角の’を半角にしました。-go補足しました。
sen.e: Besides, Seibu Kanko Bus and West Japan JR Bus offer the almost same service: Their 'Biwako Dream-go' connects Omiya Station (Saitama Prefecture, near to 23 Ward of Tokyo) and Otsu Station (Shiga Prefecture, quite near to Kyoto City) via Ikebukuro (Tokyo).
